column4: Im having trouble mounting a hard drive. i tried using the FAQ, but it failed me.  :( ive used sudo mount and the diskmounter script, but got nothin. :?
are those what you mean?
XFS
i noticed diskmounter assumed it was NTFS, so i made that change already. im gonna reboot and come back. :)
Daba: so my fstab can run again? unless theres a better way
ubuntuguide.org
oh lol congrats
i don't doubt it lol
you definitely shouldn't and especially if you haven't registered your nick... you would have been kicked for flooding
flooding? for one line?
oh
rofl then why does he want you to paste it into a pastebin
tell me what you want to do? I haven't been paying complete attention
dabar says my drive is NTFS, so im gonna plug it into my laptop with a ide-->usb adapter
so you want to mount said usb drive?
read only or with writing too
lol #windows if you do
only ext2/ext3, and ext3 only as ext2
also a unrecommended reiserfs way, and I seriously don't recommend it
you can use FAT
fat is readable by both linux and windows pretty well
if you haven't used encryption or compression linux can use ntfs filesystems for writing too... ubuntuguide.org
